Five stages: 1.Origin, 2.Cultural Elevation, 3.Popularity in the United States, 4.Chain Expansion, 5.Localization
Origin: its origin in Naples as a street food for the poor laid the foundation for its adaptability.
Cultural Elevation: the branding narrative of the "Margherita" pizza elevated its cultural status.

Popularity in the United States: brought to the United States by Italian immigrants and popularized by returning WWII soldiers, pizza became mainstream through technological and economic advancements.
Chain Expansion:the rise of chains like Pizza Hut and Domino's transformed pizza into an efficient, scalable delivery food, driving its global expansion.
Localization: through a "glocalization" strategy, pizza was adapted with local flavors and cultural contexts worldwide, cementing its status as a global culinary icon.

Four steps: 1.Boil the noodles, 2.Drain and keep some water, 3.Mix with sauce，4.Finish with toppings
Boil the noodles：Cook the noodles in about 600 ml of boiling water for 5 minutes until fully cooked and chewy.
Drain and keep some wate：Drain most of the water, leaving about 120 ml (½ cup) of noodle water to maintain the right sauce consistency.
Mix with sauce：Add the liquid spicy sauce and stir-fry over medium-low heat for about 30 seconds so the noodles absorb the flavor.
Finish with toppings：Add the dried seaweed and sesame packet, mix well, and enjoy.
Buldak Noodles picture
The dessert that appears multiple times in In Search of Lost Time is the madeleine cake.
Main Ingredients：cake flour，baking powder，unsalted butter (browned)，lemon zest / vanilla extract，eggs
Key Steps：1.Brown the butter: Heat until nutty brown and aromatic, then let cool.
Whisk eggs + sugar: Beat until pale and fluffy, add lemon zest or vanilla.
Fold in dry ingredients: Sift in flour and baking powder, gently fold.
Add browned butter: Incorporate butter into the batter until smooth.
Chill batter: Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Prepare molds: Grease and flour mold, fill ¾ full with batter.
Bake with heat shock: Start at 220°C for 4–5 min, reduce to 180°C for 5–7 min.
Serve: Unmold, dust with sugar, enjoy warm with tea.
madeleine cake picture

Five steps: 1.Ingredients Preparation,2. Kneading & Cold Fermentation, 3.Shaping, 4.Boiling (Key Step), 5.Baking
Ingredients Preparation:high-gluten flour (about 14% protein) ,salt, eggs and oil.
Kneading & Cold Fermentation: Knead for 8–10 minutes until smooth and elastic; refrigerate shaped dough overnight to enhance flavor and texture.
Shaping: Ball-and-poke method (small hole, fuller shape) or rope method (large hole, rustic look).
Boiling (Key Step): Boil each side for 30–90 seconds; creates a chewy crust, locks in moisture, and gives shine.
Baking & Topping: Bake quickly at high heat (220–245℃ / 425–475℉); sprinkle sesame, poppy seeds, or “Everything” topping while surface is wet; cool on a rack to release steam and stabilize structure.
Damien Hirst Sculptures:Large white ceiling sculptures of flying horses and winged figures, floating dramatically above the restaurant interior.
Gary Myatt Murals:Classical murals on the walls, showing mythological and historical figures.
SICIS Mosaic Flooring：Handcrafted multicolored marble mosaics, displaying geometric and floral patterns
GJL Ceiling Decorations：Decorative plaster moldings, floral garlands, rose motifs, and arched carvings
Snake Hair Design: The most iconic feature, often created with chocolate, fondant, or fruits (such as strawberries).
Bright green leaves and herbs suggest freshness.
Golden-yellow sauce evokes mythical nobility.
And dark brown crunchy pieces hint at intensity and depth.
Abstract Representation: Not a direct imitation, but symbolized through shapes or colors, such as chili peppers or red mead.
Custom Curtain System：Brass columns with flame-shaped finials, integrated with LED light strips

Five steps: 1.Salt the cabbage, 2.Prepare the seasoning paste,3. Mix thoroughly, 4.Pack and seal,5.Ferment and store
Salt the cabbage:sprinkle or soak in brine to draw out excess water, then drain
Prepare the seasoning paste: mix chili flakes, garlic, ginger, scallions, fish sauce/soy sauce, sugar, etc.
Mix thoroughly:rub the paste evenly between the cabbage leaves
Pack and seal:press cabbage tightly into a container, ensuring it is covered by its juices
Ferment and store:ferment briefly at room temperature, then refrigerate for longer fermentation and flavor preservation

six steps:1.Make Dough, 2. Add Butter, 3.Fold and Chill, 4.Cut and Shape, 5.Final Proofing, 6.Bake
Make Dough: Mix flour, yeast, sugar, salt, and water to form dough.
Add Butter：Enclose cold, pliable butter inside the dough.
Fold and Chill：Roll out and fold 2–3 times, chilling between folds.
Cut and Shape: Roll the dough into a thin sheet.
Cut and Shape: Cut the rolled sheet into triangles，roll into crescents.
Final Proofing: Let rise in a warm, humid environment until puffy.
Bake: Start at high heat for oven spring, then lower heat until golden and crisp.
French croissans picture
six steps:1.Mix the dry ingredients, 2.Whip and fold egg whites,3.Pipe and dry the batter, 4.Bake, 5.Prepare the filling, 6.Assemble and mature
Mix the dry ingredients: Grind powdered sugar and almond flour in a food processor until fine, then sift for later use.
Whip and fold egg whites: Mix part of the egg whites with the dry mixture into a paste, then fold in the remaining egg whites gradually until the batter is glossy and flows slowly.
Pipe and dry the batter: Transfer batter into a piping bag, pipe circles onto parchment or silicone mat.
Bake: Put the squeezed batter into the oven to bake.
Prepare the filling: melt chocolate and cream over a water bath, then chill until set.
Assemble and mature: Sandwich cooled macaron shells with filling, refrigerate for 24 hours for best flavor and texture.

Milk Preparation: Use whole pasteurized milk from the DOP region.
Inoculation: Add lactic acid bacteria, yeast, and Penicillium roqueforti.
Coagulation & Cutting: Add rennet, form curd, cut into cubes, and drain whey.
Molding: Place curd into molds without pressing, keeping open spaces inside.
Salting: Apply dry salt on the surface to aid whey removal and rind formation.
Piercing: Puncture with needles to introduce oxygen, activating mold and creating blue veins.
Aging: Mature in low-temperature, high-humidity conditions for months, developing flavor and texture.

five steps: 1.Prepare Puff Pastry, 2.Make the Cream Filling, 3.Assemble the Layers, 4.Decorate the Top, 5.Chill and Slice
Prepare Puff Pastry: Repeatedly roll and fold dough with butter, then bake into crisp pastry sheets.
Make the Cream Filling: Usually custard cream (milk + egg yolks + sugar + starch + vanilla).
Assemble the Layers: Alternate layers of pastry and cream (typically three pastry layers, two cream layers).
Decorate the Top: Dust with icing sugar or cover with fondant icing and create chocolate marbling.
Chill and Slice: Chill to set, then slice neatly to keep crisp layers.
French Mille-feuille picture
five steps: 1.Prepare Custard Base, 2.Infuse with Smoke, 3.Chill & Mature, 4.Churn & Freeze ,5.Serve & Pair
Prepare Custard Base: Heat milk, cream, egg yolks, and sugar into a custard, then cool.
Infuse with Smoke: Use a cold smoker or smoking gun to infuse the custard base with wood smoke.
Chill & Mature: Cool quickly and refrigerate for several hours to let the smoky flavor blend.
Churn & Freeze: Churn in an ice cream maker, then freeze until set.
Serve & Pair: Serve with nuts, caramel, or a sprinkle of sea salt for enhanced flavor.

six steps: 1.Mixing the Dough, 2.Fermentation ,3.Dividing into Dough Balls, 4.Hand Stretching, 5.Adding Toppings, 6.Baking
Mixing the Dough: Wheat flour + water + salt + yeast, knead until smooth and elastic.
Fermentation: Rest for 12–24 hours to develop flavor and extensibility.
Dividing into Dough Balls: Hand-divide into 200–280 g dough balls.
Hand Stretching: Stretch only by hand, no rolling pin, thin center with raised edge (cornicione).
Adding Toppings: Classic toppings: tomato, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.
Baking: Wood-fired oven at 485°C, bake for 60–90 seconds.
Neapolitan pizza picture
five steps: 1.Prepare the Mold, 2.Make the Base, 3.Whip the Egg Whites, 4.Fold Together, 5.Fill and Bake
Prepare the Mold: Butter the mold and coat with sugar or breadcrumbs to help the batter climb while baking.
Make the Base: Prepare a béchamel or custard base, then add egg yolks and flavoring (chocolate, cheese, etc.).
Whip the Egg Whites: Whip egg whites with sugar until stiff peaks form, creating a stable foam.
Fold Together: Gently fold the meringue into the base in batches to avoid deflating the foam.
Fill and Bake: Fill molds about 80% full, bake in a preheated oven (180–200°C) until golden and risen.
soufflé picture
five steps: 1.Tortilla Making, 2.Filling Preparation, 3.Salsa Making, 4.Toppings, 5.Assembly & Serving
Tortilla Making: Masa harina or flour dough → press/roll → cook on skillet.
Filling Preparation: Carne Asada, Carnitas, Al Pastor, or Fish.
Salsa Making: Pico de Gallo, Salsa Roja, Salsa Verde, Guacamole.
Toppings: onion, cilantro, lime.
Assembly & Serving: Heat tortilla → add filling → add toppings → add salsa → squeeze lime juice.
Mexican tacos picture
six steps:1.Cooking Ragù, 2.Making Béchamel Sauce, 3.Preparing Pasta Sheets, 4.Preparing Cheeses, 5.Layering & Assembly, 6.Baking & Resting
Cooking Ragù: Sauté onion, carrot, and celery, add minced meat, tomato, wine, and stock, then simmer slowly.
Making Béchamel Sauce: Cook butter and flour into a roux, gradually add warm milk while stirring, season until thickened.
Preparing Pasta Sheets: Use homemade or store-bought pasta sheets (boil regular type, or use no-boil type directly).
Preparing Cheeses: Mozzarella for melting and stretch, Parmesan for savory depth, Ricotta for creamy texture.
Layering & Assembly: Start with sauce at the bottom → pasta sheet → béchamel/ragù + cheese, repeat layers, finish with sauce and cheese on top.
Baking & Resting: Preheat oven to 180–190°C, bake covered for 35–45 minutes, uncover and bake until golden. Let rest at least 15 minutes before slicing.
Italian lasagna picture
five steps: 1.Prepare Vegetables, 2.Cook Meat Sauce, 3.Make Béchamel Sauce, 4.Layer & Assemble, 5.Bake & Rest
Prepare Vegetables: Salt eggplant slices to remove moisture and bitterness, parboil potatoes, then fry or bake both.
Cook Meat Sauce: Sauté onion and garlic, add lamb or beef, season with cinnamon and nutmeg, add tomato and red wine, simmer until thick.
Make Béchamel Sauce: Cook butter and flour into a roux, whisk in milk, season, then enrich with egg yolks and cheese.
Layer & Assemble: Layer potatoes at the bottom → eggplant → meat sauce → eggplant → top with thick béchamel.
Bake & Rest: Bake at 180–190°C until golden on top, then let rest at least 15 minutes before slicing.
